snippet: In the Iranian capital, all anyone can talk about is the rial, and how lives have been turned upside down during a week in which the currency’s value plunged by 40 percent.
abstract: Iranian currency, the rial, falls by a shocking 40 percent in one week and protests begin to rumble through Tehran as lives are turned upside down; experts are divided about whether the crisis has been caused more by Tehran’s longtime mismanagement of the country’s economy or by American-led sanctions that have been imposed over Iran’s refusal to halt a nuclear program.
lead_paragraph: In the Iranian capital, all anyone can talk about is the rial, and how lives have been turned upside down during a week in which the currency’s value plunged by 40 percent.

headline.seo: As Rial Slides, So Do Iranians’ Dreams
headline.main: As Iran’s Currency Keeps Tumbling, Anxiety Is Rising
headline.print_headline: As Iran Currency Keeps Tumbling, Anxiety Is Rising
